course.title: Tough Transition: Consolidating Democracy under Adverse Circumstances
course.description: This course addresses the question of "tough transitions." Democracy has come to many different lands in the twentieth and twenty-first centuries, but its record of success once there has been remarkably variable. In this seminar we will ask two interrelated questions, drawing upon both theoretical literature and case studies: what conditions are advantageous or disadvantageous for democratic consolidation? And, in the latter instance, are there ways of overcoming less than ideal starting points?
